venue.name: Hadlyme-Chester Ferry Landing (right below Gillette Castle)

item.description:
Join me on a new (to most of us) paddle to Seldon Island in Lyme, CT. We'll launch from the Hadlyme side of the Hadlyme-Chester Ferry landing which is located right below Gillette Castle. Paddle down the east side of the CT River to the entrance to Seldon Creek. We'll follow Seldon Creek around Seldon Island and then back up the river to our original launch site.

 

At the launch site there is a nice grassy picnic area with bathroom facilities (similar to Hurd Park).  Limited parking but additional parking is available in the Gillette Castle parking lot. You can drop your yak at the river and park your car at Gillette and either walk down (very nice, but steep trail with handrails) or someone can pick you up. Don't worry . . . we'll make it work.

As always, the weather conditions need to be in our favor. We will be paddling downstream with a generally current slowing tide (but certainly doable if the return is planned by apx 3 to 4pm since the tide max has just changed at apx 2:30 and current is still not at its greatest)

Tides for Hadlyme starting with June 4, 2011.

Day        High      Tide  Height   Sunrise    Moon  Time      % Moon
           /Low      Time    Feet    Sunset                    Visible

Sa   4     High   1:47 AM     3.4   5:17 AM    Rise  7:46 AM      4
     4      Low   8:39 AM     0.0   8:19 PM     Set 10:45 PM
     4     High   2:27 PM     2.7<~~~~~~
     4      Low   8:34 PM     0.5

 

FROM AL -- Be safe, Watch out for BIG boat wakes and strange undercurrents, Please wear that Life Jacket just in case.

 

Right now conditions are partly cloudy, mid-70's, and westerly winds at 5mph. Sounds good to me.

For a graphic Forecast of an area upstream by apx 30 miles:

http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KHFD&state=CT

 

For those that want to hang out afterwards, we'll gather right there at the picnic area so bring a chair, beverage and something to eat and/or share with the group. Bug spray might be helpful too. There are some grills available, but I won't be coordinating an after party "grill event." If someone else wants to coordinate/supply to make that happen, please post in your comments so folks know whether to bring meat, etc. for the grill.

Al won't be joining us on this trip and his absence will certainly reinforce just how much he does for this group.

Simple directions coming from the North:

Find your way to Gillette Castle (67 River Road, East Haddam)

Stay on River Road going past Gillette entrance

Follow signs for ferry landing

Boat Launch/Ferry Landing is where River Road and Route 148 meet

Parking lot is on the right

 

For more info, here is a kayak trip report to Seldon Island

http://www.paddling.net/places/showReport.html?1589

 

 

Okay . . . that's it. If I've missed anything, please let me know and I'll add as appropriate. Any questions/comments contact me via email through the meetup site.  Day of event my cell is 203-641-2693.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Saturday June 4 **PADDLE to SELDON ISLAND**
